  • Anonymous
  • Australia, Couple, 31-40
  • Novice Nomad
  • 2 reviews
16th Oct 2017
10.0

Very nice, quiet and clean guesthouse in the centre of Seville. Lovely staff with great tips for Alcazar, restaurants and any other questions we had. Would definitely stay there again!

    • 10.0Value For Money
    • 10.0Security
    • 10.0Location
    • 10.0Facilities
    • 10.0Staff
    • 10.0Atmosphere
    • 10.0Cleanliness
  • Anonymous
  • England, Mixed Group, 31-40
  • Novice Nomad
  • 2 reviews
16th Oct 2017
10.0

Lovely, excellent stay. We were 6 adults with a lot of experience of travelling. Good service, very close to every nice places in the city.Freddie and Arianna with their staff was very friendly and service minded. Very very clean, not expensive and if we ever go back to Seville, we'll definitely come back.

    • 10.0Value For Money
    • 10.0Security
    • 10.0Location
    • 10.0Facilities
    • 10.0Staff
    • 10.0Atmosphere
    • 10.0Cleanliness
  • Anonymous
  • Australia, Male, 41+
  • Novice Nomad
  • 1 review
11th Oct 2017
7.1

Clean spacious room. Despite language barrier staff were very friendly and accommodating. 10km from town centre but bus stop right outside hotel and it's a 40 min ride - cost E1.30 one way, so very cheap. Taxi E20 big difference.

    • 6.0Value For Money
    • 8.0Security
    • 6.0Location
    • 8.0Facilities
    • 8.0Staff
    • 6.0Atmosphere
    • 8.0Cleanliness
  • Anonymous
  • England, Male, 18-24
  • Avid Traveller
  • 11 reviews
17th Aug 2017
6.0

Had 2 rooms over my stay. First one was okay, not spotless but not a really dirty room. Habitable. Second room was slightly dirtier and hotter with window leading to the main bit? The shared bathrooms were disgusting. Staff were okay and printed my bus ticket out for me. A/C was heaven here. Rooms were secure with key but fridge didn't work and Wi-Fi sucked. Location is excellent - near to cheap places to eat and to attractions. Overall, I don't really recommend. More of a cheap hotel.

    • 6.0Value For Money
    • 8.0Security
    • 10.0Location
    • 4.0Facilities
    • 6.0Staff
    • 4.0Atmosphere
    • 4.0Cleanliness
  • Anonymous
  • Italy, Couple, 25-30
  • Avid Traveller
  • 11 reviews
14th Jul 2017
5.4

Well Priced in a good location. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Majority of the rooms had AC, unfortunately my room did not and in a heatwave it was impossible to sleep well. The room was too small for 2 people and luggage with a tiny bed and almost nowhere to stand up. The bathrooms were also in bad condition and unhygienic, finally there was a musky smell throughout the second floor. I cannot comment on the other rooms but in the end my room was not up to standard.

    • 4.0Value For Money
    • 6.0Security
    • 10.0Location
    • 2.0Facilities
    • 10.0Staff
    • 4.0Atmosphere
    • 2.0Cleanliness
  • Anonymous
  • USA, Female, 25-30
  • Novice Nomad
  • 3 reviews
25th Jun 2017
9.7

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Nuevo Pino. The staff was friendly and readily available, shower was hot, air conditioning and wifi functioned properly, rooms were clean, and the atmosphere was enjoyable. I would stay here again for sure.

    • 10.0Value For Money
    • 10.0Security
    • 10.0Location
    • 8.0Facilities
    • 10.0Staff
    • 10.0Atmosphere
    • 10.0Cleanliness
  • Anonymous
  • England, Mixed Group, 25-30
  • Novice Nomad
  • 2 reviews
13th Jun 2017
8.9

Staff was helpful, good wifi, nice room with private bathroom and small balcony, within walking distance to some nice sites.

    • 10.0Value For Money
    • 8.0Security
    • 10.0Location
    • 8.0Facilities
    • 8.0Staff
    • 8.0Atmosphere
    • 10.0Cleanliness
  • Anonymous
  • Australia, Female, 25-30
  • Novice Nomad
  • 2 reviews
13th Jun 2017
9.7

It is in the very centre of Seville All of the most poular palces are about 5-15minutes away. You can reach most of them by foot. (Sierpes.,Museums, Palza Espana, Giralda, Cathedral, Alcazar). OUr room was enough large, although the bathroom was a bit small, but, it was ok. The room includes an air-conditioner and a Tv Most of the recepcionist can speak english, and they were kind and helpful. The reception is opened 0-24.

    • 10.0Value For Money
    • 10.0Security
    • 10.0Location
    • 8.0Facilities
    • 10.0Staff
    • 10.0Atmosphere
    • 10.0Cleanliness
  • Anonymous
  • England, Couple, 31-40
  • Novice Nomad
  • 2 reviews
12th Jun 2017
10.0

Location was central to most places and close to the BUS station. Staff are very helpful, especially Juan who helped print my train tickets. There's a person there till late so no need to confirm time of arrival. Air conditioning and wi-fi was very good. Overall excellent value for money.

    • 10.0Value For Money
    • 10.0Security
    • 10.0Location
    • 10.0Facilities
    • 10.0Staff
    • 10.0Atmosphere
    • 10.0Cleanliness
  • Anonymous
  • England, Female, 41+
  • Novice Nomad
  • 1 review
12th Jun 2017
9.4

A great little hostel..really helpful and accommodating of queries/requests. Needs upgrading in certain areas eg air conditioning units, double glazing on first floor rooms front - it's just off busy city street and the small street it's on is a bus route.

title: Reviews of Hostal Nuevo Pino in Seville
